signatures.doc: Creates datetime from integer value of unix time. Returns datetime value.

arguments.doc: Time in UTC seconds from the epoch.

signatures.doc: Creates datetime in local timezone from integer value of unix time. Returns datetime value.

arguments.doc: Time in local time zone seconds from the epoch.

signatures.doc: Creates datetime from time of now. Returns datetime value.
Adds milliseconds to original date. Returns datetime with added time in milliseconds.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to add milliseconds.
Integer value, count of milliseconds to add.

signatures.doc: Sets year number to original date. Returns datetime with year set.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to set year.
Integer value, year to set to date.

signatures.doc: Sets month number to original date. Returns datetime with month set.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to set month.
Integer value, month to set to date. Expected values from 1 to 12.

signatures.doc: Sets day of month number to original date. Returns datetime with day of month set.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to set day of month.
Integer value, day of month to set to date.

signatures.doc: Sets hours number to original date. Returns datetime with hours set.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to set hours.
Integer value, hours to set to date.

signatures.doc: Sets minutes number to original date. Returns datetime with minutes set.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to set minutes.
Integer value, minutes to set to date.

signatures.doc: Sets seconds number to original date. Returns datetime with seconds set.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to set seconds.
Integer value, seconds to set to date.

signatures.doc: Sets milliseconds number to original date. Returns datetime with milliseconds set.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to set milliseconds.
Integer value, milliseconds to set to date.

signatures.doc: Returns year number of original date.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get year.

signatures.doc: Returns month number of original date.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get month.

signatures.doc: Returns day of month of original date.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get day of month.

signatures.doc: Returns day of week of original date, where Sunday is 7.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get day of week.

signatures.doc: Returns hours number of original date.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get hours.

signatures.doc: Returns minutes number of original date.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get minutes.

signatures.doc: Returns seconds number of original date.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get seconds.

signatures.doc: Returns milliseconds number of original date.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get milliseconds.

signatures.doc: Formatting dates in a local timezone in users locale. Used default locale. Look https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601 for more. `Z` for timezones not supported.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get milliseconds.
Date and time formats are specified by date and time pattern strings.

signatures.doc: Formatting dates in a UTC timezone in users locale. Used default locale. Look https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601 for more. `Z` for timezones not supported.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get milliseconds.
Date and time formats are specified by date and time pattern strings.

signatures.doc: Formatting dates in a local timezone with localization. Look https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601 for more. `Z` for timezones not supported.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get milliseconds.
Date and time formats are specified by date and time pattern strings.
Language for specified date and time pattern strings.

signatures.doc: Formatting dates in a UTC timezone with localization. Look https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601 for more. `Z` for timezones not supported.

arguments.doc: Datetime value, date to get milliseconds.
Date and time formats are specified by date and time pattern strings.
Language for specified date and time pattern strings.
